1. Summary

This Scope of Work (SOW) outlines the requirements for the procurement of comprehensive tobacco prevention services aimed at reducing tobacco use among residents of San Mateo County, California. The selected vendor will be responsible for implementing culturally relevant and evidence-based strategies to promote tobacco-free environments, provide education on the health impacts of tobacco use, and support tobacco cessation efforts. The ultimate goal is to contribute towards better public health outcomes and to reduce the prevalence of tobacco-related diseases in our community.

2. Detailed Specifications

The vendor will provide a range of tobacco prevention services, which must include, but are not limited to, the following specifications:

  1. Education and Awareness Campaigns:
    • Development and delivery of community-based educational campaigns focused on the dangers of tobacco use.
    • Legal compliance with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) guidelines for effective health communication.
    • Utilization of culturally relevant material and methods to engage diverse populations, including but not limited to youth, parents, and high-risk communities.
  2. Tobacco Cessation Programs:
    • Implementation of evidence-based cessation programs, adhering to California Department of Public Health (CDPH) guidelines.
    • Provision of resources such as quitline services, direct support groups, and pharmaceutical aids for cessation.
    • Offering workshops and training sessions that educate participants about cessation strategies.
  3. Policy Advocacy:
    • Collaboration with local regulatory agencies and community stakeholders to promote and enforce smoke-free policies.
    • Support efforts to establish comprehensive tobacco control policies in public spaces.
  4. Data Collection and Reporting:
    • Conducting assessments to evaluate the effectiveness of tobacco prevention programs.
    • Providing detailed reports to the County of San Mateo that outlines program achievements, challenges, and recommendations based on collected data.
  5. Training and Capacity Building:
    • Offering training sessions for local health professionals, community leaders, and educators on tobacco prevention strategies.
    • Developing materials for capacity building related to addressing tobacco use in specific populations.

3. Service Requirements

The vendor shall adhere to the following service requirements throughout the duration of the contract:

  1. Service Delivery:
    • All programs must be implemented in accordance with the evidence-based best practices outlined by the CDC and the CDPH.
    • All staff and facilitators involved shall possess the necessary qualifications, including knowledge of tobacco prevention and cessation strategies.
    • Services must be offered in a manner that is accessible and inclusive to all demographics, particularly low-income and marginalized communities.
  2. Partnerships and Community Engagement:
    • Active partnership with local schools, healthcare providers, and community organizations to foster collaborations and enhance outreach.
    • Community engagement must be prioritized to ensure programs are meeting the actual needs of residents.
  3. Compliance and Reporting:
    • Adherence to all applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations concerning tobacco prevention efforts.
    • Monthly progress reports must be submitted to the County of San Mateo detailing program activities, community interactions, participant feedback, and outcomes achieved.
  4. Evaluation:
    • Implementation of an evaluation framework to assess program effectiveness, including pre-and post-program surveys for participants.
    • Collation of participant engagement and health outcome data for continuous improvement of the offered services.

4. Delivery Requirements

Delivery of services and materials shall adhere to the following requirements:

  1. Timeline:
    • All scheduled activities must be executed in alignment with the project timeline provided in the proposal.
    • Notification to the County of San Mateo must occur if any delays are expected, along with proposed mitigation strategies.
  2. Location:
    • Services must be conducted in designated locations across San Mateo County, which includes public health facilities, community centers, schools, and other accessible venues.
    • Digital programming options must also be offered to expand reach, particularly through virtual platforms.
  3. Material Delivery:
    • All educational materials, promotional items, and resources must be delivered in a timely manner, based on the outlined schedule in the proposal.
    • Materials must be available in multiple languages as required to effectively reach diverse populations within the community.
  4. Oversight and Compliance:
    • The vendor shall provide access to program facilitators and materials for monitoring and compliance checks by San Mateo County staff.
    • Attending designated oversight meetings to report on progress and program implementation as requested by the County.

5. Conclusion

The County of San Mateo seeks a vendor that can deliver effective and sustainable tobacco prevention services tailored to the community's needs. The services outlined in this Scope of Work are critical to enhancing the health of our residents and maintaining the County’s commitment to public health and wellness. Proposals should reflect a thorough understanding of the specified requirements and demonstrate the ability to create impactful tobacco prevention initiatives.

Summary

The City of Winter Haven is seeking qualified contractors to provide comprehensive janitorial services for eight (8) city-owned facilities. This scope of work outlines the detailed specifications and service requirements necessary to maintain a clean, safe, and sanitary environment for all facility users. Services will include weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly cleaning tasks, including window cleaning and specialized services for different facility types.

Detailed Specifications

The contractor shall perform cleaning services at the following eight (8) locations:

  1. City Hall
  2. Public Library
  3. Community Center
  4. Police Department
  5. Fire Station 1
  6. Recreation Center
  7. Civic Center
  8. Parks Maintenance Facility

All services must comply with local, state, and federal standards, including but not limited to:

  1. OSHA Standards for Workplace Safety
  2. EPA Standards for Cleaning Products
  3. CDC Guidelines for Infection Control and Prevention

The contractor shall ensure that all cleaning personnel are trained in the appropriate use of cleaning chemicals and equipment.

Service Schedule

The following cleaning schedule is specified:

Weekly Tasks (to be performed a minimum of once per week)

  1. Dust all surfaces, including desks, countertops, and shelves.
  2. Sweep, vacuum, and mop all hard surface floors.
  3. Clean and disinfect all bathrooms, including sinks, toilets, and countertops.
  4. Empty all trash receptacles and replace liners.
  5. Clean kitchen areas, including countertops, sinks, and appliances.

Monthly Tasks (to be performed once a month)

  1. Dust and clean air vents and conditioning units.
  2. Wipe down interior windows and glass surfaces.
  3. Deep clean carpets and upholstery.
  4. Inspect and replenish restroom supplies (soap, paper towels, toilet paper).
  5. Conduct a thorough cleaning of all break rooms and kitchens.

Quarterly Tasks (to be performed once every three months)

  1. Wash exterior windows of all facilities.
  2. Detail clean walls and baseboards in all rooms.
  3. Sanitize high-touch areas such as doorknobs, light switches, and handrails.
  4. Cream and condition all wood furniture.
  5. Perform pest control inspections and treatments as necessary.

Yearly Tasks (to be performed once a year)

  1. Stripping and waxing of all hard surface floors.
  2. Deep cleaning of all carpets throughout the facilities.
  3. Conduct an assessment of cleaning supplies and chemicals, replacing as necessary.
  4. Perform high-pressure cleaning of exterior surfaces.
  5. Inventory and assess janitorial equipment and tools for any needed repairs or replacements.

Window Cleaning Specifications

The contractor is responsible for professional window cleaning services for all locations, including:

  1. Cleaning all interior and exterior windows
  2. Using safe and effective cleaning solutions that comply with EPA standards
  3. Utilizing appropriate equipment for high-rise or hard-to-reach windows
  4. Conducting inspections for cracks, leaks, or damages post-cleaning

Service Requirements

Contractors must meet the following requirements:

  1. All personnel must pass background checks to work in city facilities.
  2. Provide proof of insurance covering liability, workers’ compensation, and other relevant coverage.
  3. Ensure that all cleaning products are eco-friendly and comply with applicable regulations.
  4. Submit a detailed staffing plan, including training procedures for cleaning personnel.
  5. Establish a schedule and a communication protocol for service delivery and reporting issues.

Delivery Requirements

All services shall be delivered in accordance with the following conditions:

  1. Contractors shall develop a detailed cleaning plan agreed upon by city representatives.
  2. Service delivery should ensure minimal disruption to city operations; cleaning must be performed outside regular business hours where feasible.
  3. Promptly address any issues reported by city staff regarding cleanliness or compliance with the service agreement.
  4. Provide regular updates and reports pertaining to maintenance and service completion, as well as any needs identified during cleaning.
  5. All provided products and services must come with a satisfaction guarantee, with the promise of re-cleaning if necessary.

Conclusion

The City of Winter Haven is committed to maintaining clean and safe facilities for its residents and employees. This scope of work outlines the expectations and requirements for qualified contractors to provide janitorial services across eight locations. Proposals should demonstrate an understanding of these requirements and the capability to meet them effectively and efficiently. We look forward to partnering with a qualified contractor to fulfill this important function.

Scope of Work for Coral Shores High School Exterior Painting

I. Summary

This contract is for Coral Shores High School exterior painting of building 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Relevant overhead photographic documentation of the buildings marked. The Contractor will provide all necessary labor, materials, and services required to complete the project. The project mandates completion by August 2, 2026.

II. Detailed Specifications

  1. Work shall conform to the following standards:
    1. The most recent edition of the Florida Building Code
    2. State Requirements for Educational Facilities
    3. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
  2. Materials and equipment utilized must adhere to relevant safety and quality standards, including:
    1. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulations.
    2. National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) standards.
    3. American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM) specifications.
  3. All materials used outdoors should be inherently resistant to salt water corrosion, with fasteners and hardware made of stainless steel or hot-dipped galvanized materials.
  4. Lifts and equipment used for exterior work must establish a secured area clear of personnel, ensuring that no district personnel are present during lift operations.
  5. Final colors for finishes not indicated in the design documents will be selected by the owner post-award, requiring contractor coordination with school administration.

III. Service Requirements

  1. The Contractor is expected to provide complete, qualified labor for all tasks involved in the project.
  2. Staff and workers on site must have cleared district security checks, requiring the acquisition of Monroe County Schools ID badges prior to site access.
  3. All work areas must be clearly marked, utilizing caution tape, signage, and other methods to ensure safety and identify restricted zones.
  4. All tasks performed must accommodate the operation and schedule of the school, primarily scheduled for after 3 PM on school days, unless school is not in session. Refer to the district calendar for specific dates when work can be freely performed.
  5. Vendor is responsible for managing performance, discipline, and safety of its employees. Any unsafe conditions outside the scope of this specification must be reported to school administration immediately.

IV. Delivery Requirements

  1. All materials must be delivered on site in accordance with the project timeline, coordinated closely with school administration and the District Maintenance Department.
  2. The Contractor must ensure that deliveries are made in a manner that does not disrupt school operations, with consideration for safe passage for students and faculty.
  3. Proposals must indicate a clear timeline for initial delivery of materials and equipment, ensuring all necessary components are on-site as specified in the project's phased implementation approach.
  4. Waste and refuse from the project must be removed from the school grounds daily, keeping the area tidy and safe for school operations.

V. Eligibility to Bid

  1. Attendees of the mandatory pre-bid meeting on November ?, 2023, at 9:00 AM at Coral Shores High School, 89901 Old Hwy, Tavernier, FL 33070, are eligible to bid.
  2. Bidders must possess all appropriate licenses and regulations to perform the work in accordance with Florida Statutes and local ordinances.
  3. The contractor must provide evidence of insurance coverage, as elaborated in the insurance section of this document.
  4. Contractors previously terminated without cause from MCSD in the last three years will be excluded from consideration.
  5. Contractors on the convicted vendor list as per Florida Statute shall not be eligible to bid.
  6. Contractors, subcontractors, and employees must comply with fingerprinting and background screening requirements as dictated by the Jessica Lunsford Act.

VI. Warranty

  1. The warranty period begins on the project completion date confirmed by a work order. Warranty covers defective workmanship, materials, or equipment for one year.
  2. Any warranty claims must be addressed swiftly and without additional costs to the owner.

VII. Insurance / Bonding / Liquidated Damages

  1. Insurance requirements include:
    1. Comprehensive General Liability with minimum limits of $1,000,000 occurrence and $2,000,000 aggregate, including Monroe County District School Board as an additional insured.
    2. Commercial Auto Coverage with a combined single limit of $1,000,000.
    3. Workers Compensation at statutory limits.
  2. A performance and payment bond of 100% is required for bids over $200,000.
  3. Liquidated damages of $500 per calendar day will be imposed for delays past the established completion date.

VIII. General Requirements

  1. Conflicts in specifications will prioritize this document over design documents.
  2. The contractor must coordinate all demolition efforts with the district's maintenance department.
  3. The contractor must provide a list of all subcontractors, including their licenses and insurance, which must be approved in writing by the district before work begins.
  4. All trash must be contained and removed regularly, with provisions made by the contractor for operational debris throughout the project duration.

IX. Conclusion

This scope of work is intended to provide comprehensive direction for contractors bidding on the Coral Shores High School Painting Coating and Exterior Restoration Project. Contractors must adhere to all specifications and requirements outlined herein to ensure compliance with Monroe County School District standards and the successful completion of the project.

General Requirements

  1. All services must comply with local, state, and federal regulations, including compliance with the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.
  2. All landscape services must be performed by licensed professionals with appropriate certifications related to horticulture and landscape management.
  3. The vendor must provide proof of insurance including general liability and workers' compensation insurance.

Landscape Maintenance Tasks

  1. Mowing: Grass areas must be mowed weekly during the growing season and bi-weekly during the dormant season. Grass height should be maintained at 2.5 to 4 inches, depending on species.
  2. Edging: Edging around flower beds, sidewalks, and curbs must be completed weekly to maintain clean lines and aesthetic appearance.
  3. Blowing: Debris removal via blowing should be conducted after each mowing service to keep the sites clean and presentable. This includes sidewalks, driveways, and parking areas.

Irrigation System Maintenance

  1. 200 linear feet of irrigation lines must be regularly inspected and maintained.
  2. Any necessary repairs to broken or malfunctioning irrigation lines must be completed within 48 hours of identification.
  3. The vendor must assess and adjust the irrigation system seasonally to ensure optimal watering schedules based on weather patterns.
  4. Weed Control: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) practices should be employed for effective weed control. Pre-emergent herbicides should be applied where necessary to prevent weed growth.
  5. Flower Bed Weed Management: Flower beds should be monitored and treated for weeds monthly. Mulching should be applied bi-annually to suppress weeds and improve aesthetics.
---CRITERIA---

Service Area

Services will be provided at five specific locations designated by the City of Winter Haven. Detailed addresses and specific area requirements will be provided upon the awarding of the contract.

Timing and Scheduling

  1. The vendor must propose a regular service schedule that adheres to the frequency of tasks outlined above.
  2. Services are to be performed during regular business hours, Monday to Friday, 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM, unless prior arrangements have been made for adjustments.
  3. The vendor must notify the City of Winter Haven a minimum of 24 hours in advance in the event of any delay or rescheduling of services.

Quality Assurance

  1. All work performed must meet professional landscaping standards and reflect the City’s commitment to maintaining aesthetically pleasing public spaces.
  2. Any substandard work must be corrected at the vendor's expense within a reasonable timeframe as determined by the City of Winter Haven.
---CRITERIA---

Frequency of Services

  1. Weekly Tasks (Growing Season):
    • Mowing
    • Edging
    • Blowing
    • Weed Control in grass areas
  2. Bi-Weekly Tasks (Dormant Season):
    • Mowing
    • Edging
    • Blowing
    • Weed Control in grass areas
  3. Monthly Tasks:
    • Flower Bed Weed Management
    • Inspection of irrigation system
  4. Quarterly Tasks:
    • Review and adjust irrigation schedules
    • Mulching in flower beds
  5. Yearly Tasks:
    • Annual review of landscape layout and health
    • Soil testing and amendments as needed

Reporting Requirements

  1. The vendor must provide a bi-weekly report summarizing completed tasks, areas of concern, and recommendations.
  2. Annual review of landscape layout and health
  3. Soil testing and amendments as needed

Weekly Tasks (to be performed a minimum of once per week)

  1. Dust all surfaces, including desks, countertops, and shelves.
  2. Sweep, vacuum, and mop all hard surface floors.
  3. Clean and disinfect all bathrooms, including sinks, toilets, and countertops.
  4. Empty all trash receptacles and replace liners.
  5. Clean kitchen areas, including countertops, sinks, and appliances.

Monthly Tasks (to be performed once a month)

  1. Dust and clean air vents and conditioning units.
  2. Wipe down interior windows and glass surfaces.
  3. Deep clean carpets and upholstery.
  4. Inspect and replenish restroom supplies (soap, paper towels, toilet paper).
  5. Conduct a thorough cleaning of all break rooms and kitchens.

Quarterly Tasks (to be performed once every three months)

  1. Wash exterior windows of all facilities.
  2. Detail clean walls and baseboards in all rooms.
  3. Sanitize high-touch areas such as doorknobs, light switches, and handrails.
  4. Cream and condition all wood furniture.
  5. Perform pest control inspections and treatments as necessary.

Yearly Tasks (to be performed once a year)

  1. Stripping and waxing of all hard surface floors.
  2. Deep cleaning of all carpets throughout the facilities.
  3. Conduct an assessment of cleaning supplies and chemicals, replacing as necessary.
  4. Perform high-pressure cleaning of exterior surfaces.
  5. Inventory and assess janitorial equipment and tools for any needed repairs or replacements.

Window Cleaning Specifications

The contractor is responsible for professional window cleaning services for all locations, including:

  1. Cleaning all interior and exterior windows
  2. Using safe and effective cleaning solutions that comply with EPA standards
  3. Utilizing appropriate equipment for high-rise or hard-to-reach windows
  4. Conducting inspections for cracks, leaks, or damages post-cleaning

Service Requirements

Contractors must meet the following requirements:

  1. All personnel must pass background checks to work in city facilities.
  2. Provide proof of insurance covering liability, workers’ compensation, and other relevant coverage.
  3. Ensure that all cleaning products are eco-friendly and comply with applicable regulations.
  4. Submit a detailed staffing plan, including training procedures for cleaning personnel.
  5. Establish a schedule and a communication protocol for service delivery and reporting issues.

Delivery Requirements

All services shall be delivered in accordance with the following conditions:

  1. Contractors shall develop a detailed cleaning plan agreed upon by city representatives.
  2. Service delivery should ensure minimal disruption to city operations; cleaning must be performed outside regular business hours where feasible.
  3. Promptly address any issues reported by city staff regarding cleanliness or compliance with the service agreement.
  4. Provide regular updates and reports pertaining to maintenance and service completion, as well as any needs identified during cleaning.
  5. All provided products and services must come with a satisfaction guarantee, with the promise of re-cleaning if necessary.

Conclusion

The City of Winter Haven is committed to maintaining clean and safe facilities for its residents and employees. This scope of work outlines the expectations and requirements for qualified contractors to provide janitorial services across eight locations. Proposals should demonstrate an understanding of these requirements and the capability to meet them effectively and efficiently. We look forward to partnering with a qualified contractor to fulfill this important function.

Scope of Work for Ornamental Fencing Services

1. Summary

This document outlines the scope of work required for the procurement of ornamental fencing services for OpenGov Professional Services PRO Partners, CA. The aim is to enhance the aesthetic value and security of our premises through the installation of high-quality ornamental fencing that meets the standards of durability, safety, and design integrity. Specialized services are sought from qualified contractors who have a proven track record in ornamental fencing installations.

2. Detailed Specifications

The ornamental fencing to be installed must adhere to the following specifications and standards:

  1. Material Standards:
    • Material must be galvanized steel, wrought iron, or aluminum.
    • All materials must comply with ASTM A123/A123M for Zinc Coating on Iron and Steel Products.
    • Powder coating must meet the standards set by AAMA 2604 for durability and finish quality.
    • Wooden components must conform to ANSI/HPVA 1-2009 for hardwood and softwood grading.
  2. Design Specifications:
    • Fencing height must be a minimum of 6 feet with options for custom heights as specified by the project requirements.
    • Design patterns must be visually appealing, incorporating ornamental features approved by the OpenGov design team.
    • Finials, caps, and other decorative elements must ensure compatibility and structural stability.
  3. Installation Standards:
    • Installation must comply with the International Building Code (IBC) and local building codes.
    • All anchors, fasteners, and other hardware must withstand high wind loads, adhering to ASCE 7-16 standards.
    • Post spacing must be no more than 8 feet apart, with adequate bracing for added support.
  4. Finish Specifications:
    • All fencing surfaces exposed to the elements must be treated with a rust-inhibiting primer and finished with a high-quality weather-resistant paint or powder coat.
    • Color specifications must align with existing OpenGov branding, including any custom colors that may be required.
  5. Site Conditions:
    • Assess and prepare the site before installation, including the removal of existing fencing, vegetation, and debris.
    • Manage soil conditions to ensure proper post installation, including any necessary excavation and backfill.

3. Service Requirements

The contractor must fulfill the following service requirements:

  1. Pre-Installation Consultation:
    • Conduct a comprehensive site assessment and consultation with OpenGov representatives.
    • Provide design options and technical recommendations based on site-specific conditions.
  2. Project Management:
    • Assign a dedicated project manager to oversee all aspects of the fencing installation.
    • Provide regular updates on project progress, including timelines and any potential challenges.
  3. Quality Assurance:
    • Implement a quality assurance process to ensure adherence to specifications and standards.
    • Provide a detailed checklist for inspection and approval before final payment.
  4. Warranty:
    • Offer a minimum 10-year warranty on materials and a 5-year warranty on workmanship.
    • Detail conditions of warranty coverage and service agreements for maintenance post-installation.
  5. Compliance:
    • Ensure that all services meet or exceed health, safety, and environmental protection standards.
    • Maintain appropriate insurance (liability and worker’s compensation) as specified in contract terms.

4. Delivery Requirements

The following delivery requirements must be strictly observed:

  1. Timeline:
    • The contractor must provide a detailed project schedule, including milestones for procurement, installation, and inspection.
    • All work must be completed within a predetermined timeframe, with allowances for weather-related delays as necessary.
  2. Material Delivery:
    • All materials must be delivered to the job site no later than 7 days prior to the scheduled start of the installation.
    • Packages must be clearly labeled and manifest must be provided to confirm quantities and specifications met.
  3. Site Access:
    • Ensure that access to the site is clear and secure, with provisions made for traffic control as necessary during installation.
    • Coordinate with OpenGov facilities management to ensure proper access for delivery and installation vehicles.
  4. Post-Installation Duties:
    • Conduct a final inspection with OpenGov representatives upon completion of installation.
    • Restore the site to its original condition, removing all debris and construction materials.

5. Conclusion

This scope of work serves as the basis for the procurement of ornamental fencing services required by OpenGov Professional Services PRO Partners, CA. Contractors who wish to participate in this solicitation must adhere to the outlined specifications and requirements, ensuring excellence in quality, safety, and aesthetics throughout the project.

prompt: Palm Tree Maintenance - Park Rd. 22 & Espleanade
response:
1. Summary

The City of Corpus Christi, Texas, invites proposals for the maintenance of palm trees located at Park Rd. 22 & Esplanade. This maintenance is essential to preserve the health and aesthetics of the palm trees, ensuring their longevity and visual appeal in this public area. The selected contractor will be responsible for executing comprehensive maintenance services, including pruning, fertilization, pest control, and overall health assessment of the palm trees. The project aims to enhance the beauty of the area while maintaining safety and ecological integrity.

2. Detailed Specifications

The contractor shall adhere to the following specifications regarding the maintenance of palm trees:

Work Site and Conditions

  1. The work shall be performed in the designated locations.
  2. Contractor shall supply the Work Coordinator with a work schedule on Mondays by 7:00am to indicate the normal starting and completion time for the operation.
  3. Work Hours: The Contractor will confine all operations to daylight hours, Monday through Thursday, unless one of the days is a City of Corpus Christi designated holiday.
  4. Non-Work Hours: The Contractor may not store any equipment or tools on any site. After completion of work at any site, the Contractor must remove all equipment, supplies, and materials from that site.
  5. The Contractor will have 10 working days from the time they receive the Notice to Proceed to complete the job.Contractor Quality Control and Superintendence

        The Contractor will also provide supervision of the work to insure it complies with the service agreement requirements.

 

3.         Safety Requirements

  1. Public Safety and Convenience: The safety of the public and the convenience of traffic shall be regarded as prime importance.  All portions of streets shall be kept open to traffic.  The Contractor shall coordinate all Work with the Work Coordinator and shall place warning signs in accordance with the current version of the Texas Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices.  Signs, sign stands, safety flags, and all other safety materials or devices as well as safety vests, helmets, and googles will be required to protect the maintenance workers and the traveling public and will be furnished by the Contractor. The Contractor will be responsible for the maintenance or replacement of these items as necessary.  If at any time work is in progress, the traffic control devices do not accomplish the intended purpose due to weather or other conditions affecting the safe handling of traffic, the Contractor shall immediately make necessary changes thereto to correct the unsatisfactory conditions.  These provisions for directing traffic will not be paid for directly but shall be subsidiary to the various bid items of this contract.

 

4.         Equipment

  1. All Contractor’s grounds maintenance equipment must be equipped with safety devices which conform to manufacturer’s standards and all applicable OSHA regulations to prevent damage to property. All equipment shall be kept in good operating condition and shall always be maintained to provide a clean sharp cut of trees and bushes. All equipment shall be approved by the Work Coordinator. The typical type of equipment that may be required for this job would be chainsaws, pole saws, hand saws, manual extension saws, lift and/or bucket truck, and truck/trailer.

 

  1. Should the Contractor's equipment require service while at any location, the Contractor must notify the Work Coordinator. The Contractor shall not permit any oil, grease, or lubricants to spill onto or to contaminate the soil. The Contractor shall be responsible for any clean up and disposal of contaminated soil in accordance with all Applicable City, State, and Federal Regulations.

 

5.         Security and Protection of Property

  1. Protection of Property:
  1. The Contractor shall take proper measures to protect all property which   might be damaged by Contractor’s Work hereunder, and in case of any damage resulting from any act or omission on the part of or on behalf of the Contractor, the Contractor shall restore at the Contractor’s own expense the damaged property to a condition similar or equal to that existing before such damage was done or shall make good such damage in an acceptable manner.

 

  1. All damage which is not repaired or compensated for by the Contractor will be repaired or compensated for by City forces at the Contractor's expense. All expenses charged by the City for repair work or compensation shall be deducted from any monies owed to the Contractor.

 

 

6.          Notifications and Inspections

  1. Each Monday morning prior to 7:00 a.m., the Contractor shall email the Work Coordinator, the locations being serviced that week for approval.  The Work Coordinator will then meet contractor at each location, each time, to review the needed maintenance. If the locations listed on the approved schedule were not serviced and the schedule requires modifications the revised schedule shall be submitted to the Work Coordinator by 3:00 p.m. the day the location was missed.  No work shall be done without proper, prior notification.

 

  1. A list of completed locations that are ready for inspection shall be emailed to the Work Coordinator, no later than 7:00 a.m. on the day to be inspected.  When the location is completed, the assigned Work Coordinator shall inspect the site and advise the Contractor of any discrepancies or rejections.  To receive credit for tree maintenance rejected locations, the Contractor shall take whatever action necessary to correct the discrepancies within one working day.  For this contract, workdays shall include Monday-Thursday, unless one of the days is a City designated holiday.

 

  1. The Contractor shall submit an invoice ONLY after the job is completed.

 

  1. The Work Coordinator shall have the right to examine the supplies, materials and equipment used by the Contractor and employees at any time during the contract or extension terms.

 

  1. Work Crew Supervision: The Contractor shall always provide qualified supervision of each crew while working under this Contract. Each supervisor shall be authorized by the Contractor to accept and act upon all directives issued by the Work Coordinator. Failure of the supervisor to act on said directives shall be enough cause to give notice that the Contractor is in default on the contract unless such directives create potential personal injury or safety hazards.

 

  1. The contractor shall promptly (same day) notify Work Coordinator of any broken or damaged property or citizens’ complaints and/or concerns.

 

7. The contractor shall be responsible for the replacement of any plantings that may be damaged due to improper performance of designated maintenance activities. In such case, The Work Coordinator shall specify when replacement is to be made. If the Contractor fails to replace the damages according to instruction of the Work Coordinator, the Contractor agrees that the City of Corpus Christi, may replace and/or reduce the Contractor payment by the amount of the replacement cost.

Thank you for considering this solicitation. The City of Corpus Christi looks forward to collaborating with a qualified contractor to ensure the ongoing health and beauty of the palm trees at Park Rd. 22 & Esplanade.

response:
1. Summary

The County of San Mateo, California, is seeking proposals for the provision of towing services. The selected contractor will assist in managing the towing of vehicles in various situations, including but not limited to accidents, illegal parking, and abandoned vehicles. The aim is to ensure public safety, maintain traffic flow, and uphold County regulations. The service provider will be expected to adhere to all local, state, and federal laws, as well as to the policies established by the County of San Mateo. This document outlines the detailed specifications, service requirements, and delivery standards necessary for the successful execution of this contract.

2. Detailed Specifications

The contractor shall provide towing services that meet the following specifications:

  1. Types of Vehicles Towed:
    • Light-duty vehicles (cars, SUVs)
    • Medium-duty vehicles (vans, light trucks)
    • Heavy-duty vehicles (trucks, buses)
  2. Response Time: The contractor must respond to a towing request within 30 minutes for priority calls and within 60 minutes for standard requests, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
  3. Equipment Standards:
    • Towing vehicles must conform to California Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV) regulations.
    • All towing equipment must be well-maintained and able to handle the specific types of vehicles to be towed.
  4. Insurance Requirements:
    • The contractor must carry a minimum of $1 million in liability insurance.
    • Worker’s Compensation insurance in accordance with California state law.
  5. Licensing: The contractor must possess all necessary local and state licenses required for towing services.
  6. Compliance Standards:
    • The contractor must comply with California Vehicle Code Section 22658 concerning private property towing.
    • The contractor must comply with the City of San Mateo Municipal Code related to towing regulations.

3. Service Requirements

The contractor will be required to perform the following services:

  1. Towing: Safely tow vehicles as directed by the County's designated officials.
  2. Storage: Provide secure storage for towed vehicles:
    • Storage facilities must be compliant with local safety regulations and easily accessible to vehicle owners.
    • Vehicles must be stored in a manner that prevents damage and theft.
  3. Release of Vehicles: Facilitate the process for vehicle owners to recover their vehicles, including appropriate documentation and payment processes.
  4. Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of each towing incident including:
    • Date and time of tow
    • Location of tow
    • Vehicle details (make, model, license plate)
    • Reason for tow
  5. Communication: Maintain open lines of communication with County officials regarding towing status and expediency.

4. Delivery Requirements

Delivery of services will require the following:

  1. Service Availability: The contractor must provide towing services on a 24/7 basis, including holidays.
  2. Equipment Availability: Ensure the availability of sufficient towing equipment to manage multiple concurrent requests as needed.
  3. Communication:
    • Establish a dedicated phone line for immediate communication with County officials.
    • Provide an online system or app for towing requests and tracking.
  4. Reporting: Provide bi-weekly reporting to the County on towing activities, including:
    • Total vehicles towed
    • Breakdown by type of service requested
    • Average response times
  5. Compliance Audits: Agree to bi-annual audits to ensure compliance with the terms of this scope of work and associated regulations.

5. Proposal Submission

Interested contractors must submit a formal proposal including:

  1. Detailed description of experience in towing services.
  2. List of available equipment and resources.
  3. Evidence of required insurance and licenses.
  4. Proposed pricing structure and fee schedule for towing and storage services.
  5. References from previous clients, especially within municipal or governmental operations.

6. Timeline

The timeline for proposals and implementation is as follows:

  1. Proposal Submission Deadline: [Insert Deadline]
  2. Review of Proposals: [Insert Date]
  3. Interviews/Final Selection: [Insert Date]
  4. Start Date for Services: [Insert Date]

7. Contact Information

For any questions regarding this Scope of Work, please contact:

  • Name: [Insert Name]
  • Title: [Insert Title]
  • Email: [Insert Email]
  • Phone: [Insert Phone Number]

The County of San Mateo looks forward to receiving your proposals and working collaboratively to enhance public safety through effective and efficient towing services.

Scope of Work for the Purchase of Reverse Osmosis (RO) Membranes

1. Summary

The Town of Davie, Florida, is seeking proposals for the supply of high-quality Reverse Osmosis (RO) membranes. The membranes will be integral to our water filtration systems, ensuring compliance with local and federal water quality standards. The selected vendor will be responsible for providing membranes that meet the specified technical standards, functionality, and service requirements as outlined in this scope of work. The vendor will also be required to assist in the delivery and installation of the membranes at our designated facility.

2. Detailed Specifications

The RO membranes must meet or exceed the following specifications:

  1. Type:
    • Thin Film Composite (TFC) membranes.
  2. Membrane Area:
    • Standard membrane area options available in 100, 200, 400, and 800 square feet.
  3. Filtration Rate:
    • Membranes must have a minimum permeate flow rate of 99% salt rejection at specified feed conditions.
  4. Operating Pressure:
    • Should operate effectively at pressures ranging from 50 to 120 PSI.
  5. Temperature Tolerance:
    • Must perform optimally in temperatures from 40°F to 120°F.
  6. Dimensions:
    • Membrane elements should have standard dimensions to fit existing housings.
  7. Certifications:
    • Membranes must have NSF/ANSI certification for drinking water standards.
    • Meeting US EPA Safe Drinking Water Act regulations.
  8. Quality Standards:
    • The membranes must adhere to quality control standards akin to ISO 9001.
  9. Warranties:
    • Minimum one-year warranty against defects in material and workmanship.

3. Service Requirements

The selected vendor is required to provide the following services:

  1. Technical Support:
    • Provide technical assistance for installation, operation, and maintenance of the RO membranes.
    • Offer consultation services for optimal system performance and troubleshooting.
  2. Training:
    • Conduct training sessions for staff on membrane operation, maintenance, and best practices.
  3. Documentation:
    • Supply comprehensive user manuals, installation guides, and warranty information with each membrane order.
    • Provide Product Safety Data Sheets (PSDS) as necessary.
  4. Maintenance Services:
    • Option for scheduled preventive maintenance agreements for ongoing support.

4. Delivery Requirements

All deliveries must comply with the following conditions:

  1. Delivery Timeline:
    • Membranes should be delivered within a specified timeline, not exceeding 30 days from the date of order confirmation.
  2. Packaging:
    • Membranes must be properly packaged to prevent damage during transportation. Suitable materials include:
      • Industrial-grade storage containers.
      • Cushioning materials to limit movement and impact.
  3. Delivery Location:
    • Products are to be delivered to the Town of Davie Water Treatment Facility located at [insert address].
  4. Receiving Procedure:
    • Upon delivery, all product shipments must be inspected against the purchase order for accuracy and completeness.
    • Any discrepancies or damage must be documented and reported to the vendor immediately.
  5. Shipping Costs:
    • The vendor is responsible for all shipping costs unless otherwise agreed upon in the contract.

5. Proposal Submission Format

Bidders are required to submit their proposals in the following format:

  1. Cover Letter detailing interest and qualifications.
  2. Company Profile, including history, experience, and references.
  3. Detailed response to the scope of work, addressing specifications, services, and delivery.
  4. Pricing Breakdown inclusive of all costs, warranties, and potential additional charges.
  5. Proposed timeline for delivery and installation if applicable.
  6. Proof of certifications and compliance documents.

6. Evaluation Criteria

Proposals submitted will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

  1. Compliance with specifications and service requirements.
  2. Pricing structure and overall value.
  3. Vendor experience and past performance.
  4. Quality of customer support and technical assistance offerings.
  5. Delivery timelines and logistics plan.

7. Conclusion

The Town of Davie, Florida, looks forward to receiving your proposals. Please ensure that all submissions are complete and adhere to the guidelines mentioned in this scope of work. Proposals should be submitted electronically in PDF format to [insert email address] by [insert deadline]. The Town reserves the right to negotiate with the vendor selected for award, as well as to reject any and all proposals deemed not in the Town's best interest.

---CRITERIA---
  • Reference Standards
    •  American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM)
      •  ASTM-D4516
      • ASTM D4194
      •  ASTM D6161
      • ASTM D6284
    • American Nation Standards Institute (ANSI)/ National Sanitary Foundation (NSF) Standard 6
  •  Manufacturers QA/QC
    • Membrane elements shall be manufactured in accordance with ISO/9000-9001.
  •  NSF Certification
    • Requirements for NSF Standard 61 for membranes supplied shall apply to this specification.
---CRITERIA---

The following items define the scope of work for this project:

  1. Supply and delivery of a quantity of eight hundred seventy-six (876) membrane elements (8 x 40 inches) as specified in Part 2 of Scope of Supply  (attached – Exhibit A).
  2. Supply and delivery of spare parts, spare parts shall be provided in accordance with Scope of Supply (attached – Exhibit A).       

  3. Final acceptance of the reverse osmosis membrane elements is subject to the results of inspection by WBMWD and its agents.

  4. Delivery –The completion time of the membrane replacement is paramount. The time of completion for the work will be ninety (90) consecutive calendar days from the Notice of Award.

The membrane element manufacturer (herein called Supplier) shall furnish the membrane elements and appurtenances, in accordance with the requirements specified herein.

1. Summary

This Scope of Work (SOW) outlines the requirements for the procurement of ten (10) commercial toolboxes for Yuba County, California. The purpose of this purchase is to provide secure and organized storage solutions for tools and equipment used by county employees. The toolboxes will enhance efficiency in the field and ensure the safety and maintenance of tools used across various departments.

2. Detailed Specifications

The selected vendor must provide commercial-grade toolboxes that meet or exceed the following specifications:

  1. Dimensions: Toolboxes must have dimensions of 36" (H) x 48" (W) x 24" (D).
  2. Material: Durable, weather-resistant steel with a minimum gauge of 14, with a powder-coated finish to prevent rust and corrosion.
  3. Locking Mechanism: Each toolbox must include a heavy-duty, tamper-resistant locking mechanism to secure tools. Provide two keys per toolbox.
  4. Storage Capacity: Minimum internal storage capacity of 20 cubic feet, with adjustable shelving or modular options.
  5. Weight Capacity: Each toolbox must support a minimum weight capacity of 1000 lbs. (static load).
  6. Casters: Four (4) heavy-duty swivel casters for mobility, with at least two (2) having locking mechanisms.
  7. Weatherproofing: All toolboxes must include rubber seals to ensure waterproof and dustproof capabilities.
  8. Warranty: A minimum warranty period of five (5) years covering defects in materials and workmanship.
  9. Standards Compliance: All toolboxes must be compliant with OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Administration) safety standards, as well as applicable ANSI (American National Standards Institute) standards for tool storage systems.

3. Service Requirements

The selected vendor must fulfill the following service requirements:

  1. Pre-Purchase Consultation: Provide a consultation session to discuss the specific needs of Yuba County and demonstrate the available options.
  2. Customization: If applicable, accommodate any requests for customization, including color options, additional features, or branding with Yuba County’s logo.
  3. Delivery Setup: Delivery and setup of toolboxes on-site, including installation of any additional components as necessary.
  4. Training: Provide training on effectively utilizing and maintaining the toolboxes to designated Yuba County staff.
  5. Post-Purchase Support: Offer ongoing customer support for any issues that may arise within the warranty period. This includes replacement parts, repair services, and general inquiries.

4. Delivery Requirements

Delivery of the commercial toolboxes must adhere to the following conditions:

  1. Delivery Date: All ten (10) toolboxes must be delivered no later than eight (8) weeks from the date of the purchase order.
  2. Delivery Location: Toolboxes are to be delivered to the following address: Yuba County Public Works Department, 915 8th Street, Marysville, CA 95901.
  3. Delivery Time: Deliveries should be scheduled during normal business hours (Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM) unless otherwise agreed upon.
  4. Inspection: Upon delivery, all toolboxes will be inspected by designated Yuba County staff for compliance with specified requirements and damage. The vendor will be responsible for any replacement or repair needed due to shipping damage.
  5. Documentation: The delivery must include a packing list detailing each toolbox along with any certifications or warranty information.

5. Contract Duration

The contract for this purchase will be effective upon the signing of the agreement and will last until all toolboxes are delivered and accepted by Yuba County, including any required training and support activities.

6. Payment Terms

Payment will be processed within thirty (30) days after the satisfactory delivery, installation, and acceptance of the toolboxes, pending receipt of the appropriate invoice and documentation as outlined in the delivery requirements.

7. Conclusion

The successful completion of this procurement will significantly enhance the day-to-day operations of Yuba County employees by providing secure, durable, and functional tool storage solutions. Vendors submitting proposals must demonstrate their ability to meet the specified requirements and provide references or examples of previous successful contracts of a similar nature.

prompt: Scanning Module for Trimble Business Center
response:
Scope of Work for the Acquisition of Scanning Module for Trimble Business Center

1. Summary

This Scope of Work (SOW) outlines the requirements for procuring a scanning module compatible with Trimble Business Center (TBC) to enhance the City of Corpus Christi’s capabilities in working with Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) LiDAR and photogrammetry data. The City holds a TBC Survey Advanced license and seeks to further develop its ability to clean and manipulate point clouds, create surfaces, and conduct CAD work through the integration of the scanning module. The software must support efficient data processing and ensure compatibility with existing workflows and hardware systems.

2. Detailed Specifications

The scanning module must meet the following detailed specifications:

  1. Compatibility:
    • Seamless integration with Trimble Business Center Survey Advanced version 5.0 or newer.
    • Support for various LiDAR data formats, including LAS, LAZ, and ASCII.
  2. Functional Capabilities:
    • Enhanced point cloud processing features to facilitate noise reduction, point classification, and surface extraction.
    • Robust tools for importing, managing, and exporting photogrammetric data.
    • Support for detailed georeferencing using transformation tools.
    • Capability for large data set management, supporting at least 1 billion points without performance degradation.
    • Tools for generating DEMs, DTMs, and 3D models from point clouds.
    • Advanced editing features, including segmentation, filtering, and editing of point clouds.
  3. User Interface:
    • Intuitive and user-friendly UI that maintains consistency with existing TBC interfaces.
    • Customizable dashboards and shortcuts to streamline workflow.
  4. Documentation and Support:
    • Comprehensive user manuals and tutorials for training and reference.
    • Access to customer support and technical assistance during project implementation and post-installation.
  5. Licensing:
    • The module must be available for individual licensing or as part of a broader licensing structure with potential for volume discounts.

3. Service Requirements

The successful vendor shall provide the following services to ensure successful acquisition and integration of the scanning module:

  1. Installation and Configuration:
    • Assistance in the installation of the scanning module within TBC.
    • Configuration support to tailor settings to meet specific project needs.
  2. Training and Knowledge Transfer:
    • Onsite or virtual training sessions for staff to become proficient in using the scanning module.
    • Provision of training materials, including video tutorials, FAQs, and best practice guides.
  3. Technical Support:
    • Provision of technical support for a minimum period of one year, including troubleshooting and software updates.
    • Access to an online support portal for reporting issues and managing support tickets.
  4. Maintenance and Updates:
    • Regular maintenance schedules and prompt updates to ensure software security and efficiency.
    • Options for additional support or services following the completion of initial support phase.

4. Delivery Requirements

The vendor must adhere to the following delivery requirements to ensure a successful procurement process:

  1. Delivery Timeline:
    • The vendor shall provide a detailed timeline outlining key milestones from acceptance of the proposal to the final installation and training sessions.
    • All products and services shall be delivered within 30 days from the execution of the purchase order, unless otherwise agreed upon.
  2. Delivery Method:
    • The scanning module software must be delivered electronically via a secure download link, along with any necessary license keys.
    • Data backups and installation files on physical media (USB, CD/DVD) should also be provided, if requested.
  3. Documentation:
    • All delivery must include documentation for installation, user guides, and any relevant training materials packaged appropriately.
    • Electronic copies of all documentation must be provided alongside physical copies during delivery.
  4. Quality Assurance:
    • The vendor must ensure that all software is tested for quality and performance before delivery.
    • Support for immediate resolution of any defects identified upon implementation within the warranty period.

5. Conclusion

The City of Corpus Christi’s acquisition of a scanning module for Trimble Business Center is essential for improving our capacity to analyze and manipulate UAV LiDAR and photogrammetry data effectively. The successful vendor must ensure compatibility with our existing systems while providing extensive support and training. Adherence to the detailed specifications, service requirements, and delivery expectations is vital for the successful execution of this project. Proposals should clearly demonstrate the vendor’s ability to meet these outlined requirements effectively.

response:
Scope of Work for Quick Terrain Modeler Version 8 - Portable License

1. Summary

The City of Corpus Christi is seeking proposals for the procurement of Quick Terrain Modeler (QTM) Version 8, which includes a non-network enabled portable license with a hardware dongle. The package should encompass one year of annual maintenance that covers technical support and access to new versions. The purpose of this procurement is to facilitate terrain modeling and analysis essential for enhancing our city's planning, development, and environmental initiatives.

2. Detailed Specifications

Proponents must meet the following specifications to ensure compliance with our requirements. The Quick Terrain Modeler Version 8 must adhere to the subsequent criteria and relevant standards:

  1. License Type: Portable License (Non-Network Enabled) with Hardware Dongle
  2. Software Version: Quick Terrain Modeler Version 8
  3. Included Maintenance: One year of annual maintenance, which must consist of:
    1. Technical Support: Access to skilled technical staff capable of addressing software issues and user inquiries.
    2. Updates: Access to software updates and new versions released within the maintenance period.
  4. System Compatibility: The software must be compatible with commonly used Operating Systems such as:
    1. Windows 10 or later
    2. Windows Server 2016 or later
  5. Operational Requirements: The software must effectively support the execution of the following functions:
    1. LAS/LAZ (Lidar)
    2. ASCII Grid
    3. GeoTIFF
    4. Point Cloud data
    1. 3D terrain visualization
    2. Terrain modeling and analysis
    3. Extraction of elevation profiles
    4. Data importation from various formats including but not limited to:
    5. Exporting visualizations to formats compatible with GIS and CAD software.
  6. Documentation: Comprehensive user manuals, installation guides, and online help documentation should be included.

3. Service Requirements

The Vendor shall provide services as detailed below to ensure a smooth implementation and ongoing support for the Quick Terrain Modeler software:

  1. Implementation Support: Assistance in the software installation process, ensuring successful deployment on designated workstations.
  2. Training: Provisions for remote training sessions that equip users with the necessary skills to navigate and operate the software effectively. Training should include:
    1. Basic functionality and features of the software.
    2. Advanced techniques for 3D terrain modeling and analysis.
    3. Best practices for data management and visualization.
  3. Maintenance Notifications: Timely notifications for any available updates, ensuring software is maintained to the latest standards.

4. Delivery Requirements

The delivery of the Quick Terrain Modeler software and associated materials shall comply with the following stipulations:

    1. Delivery Method: All software, licenses, and hardware dongles must be delivered via courier or other secure delivery methods to:

City of Corpus Christi

Attention: Public Works Department

2525 Hygeia St, Corpus Christi, TX 78415

  1. Delivery Timeline: The Vendor must commit to delivering the complete package within 30 days of contract execution.
  2. Packaging: All items must be adequately packaged to prevent damage during transit. Software licenses and hardware must be accompanied by labeled and sealed documentation.
  3. Installation Schedule: The Vendor is expected to coordinate with the City to establish an installation and training schedule, with preferred timelines to be discussed upon award of the contract.
  4. Invoice Submission: Invoices should be submitted upon delivery and acceptance of all equipment and services, and must reflect detailed billing for items and services rendered.

5. Conclusion

All proposals must conform to the outlined scope of work to ensure that the City of Corpus Christi receives a fully functional Quick Terrain Modeler Version 8 with necessary maintenance and support options. Proposals will be evaluated based on compliance with specifications, service offerings, delivery timelines, and pricing. The selected Vendor will enter into a contract with the City for the provision of these services and products as outlined in this solicitation.

prompt: Treated and Untreated Water Rate Studies
response:
Comprehensive Water Rate Study

The selected consultant will be responsible for reviewing the Agency’s existing wholesale treated rate and untreated rate frameworks, assessing revenue adequacy, and developing a multi-year rate schedule informed by recent financial data, regulatory mandates, and industry best practices. This work will include the development of a detailed financial planning and rate model, analysis of rate structure alternatives, and presentation of findings and recommendations.

 

The consultant will collaborate with internal stakeholders, including Finance Department, Integrated Planning Department, and executive leadership, to align recommendations with operational needs and strategic priorities. Additional input will be gathered through workshops and publicly noticed Board meetings, in accordance with applicable legal requirements, to ensure transparency and community engagement.

 

Key Objectives:

  • Develop a long-term financial plan that incorporates operational and capital funding needs, reserve targets, debt service coverage requirements, and other policy objectives.
  • Evaluate and update the wholesale treated water rate and untreated water rate structures to ensure revenue sufficiency, fairness, alignment with industry standards, and regulatory compliance.
  • CY 2027-2030 Wholesale Treated Water Rates - Analyze the current fixed-to-variable revenue ratio and provide recommendations to further improve financial resilience while continuing to incentivize efficient water use. Recommend rates
  • CY 2027 Untreated Water Rates - Evaluate and provide alternatives to the existing rate structure for untreated water customers, including the feasibility of setting multi-year rates. 

 

Detailed Scope of Work

 

  1. Project initiation and data collection:
    1. Conduct a project kickoff meeting with Agency staff.
    2. Develop a detailed project schedule and communication plan.
    3. Identify and collect all necessary data including, but not limited to:
        1. Historical and projected water demands
        2. Financial reports and budgets
        3. Capital Improvement Plan funding
        4. Current rate structures
        5. Customer classes and usage patterns
        6. Operational and maintenance costs
        7. Reserve policy requirements
        8. Debt service coverage requirements

 

Deliverables: 

  • Virtual Project Kick-off Meeting
  • Request for Information
  • Project schedule

 

  1. Financial Planning & Rate Model Development:
  1. Develop a comprehensive financial planning and water rate model that projects revenues, expenses, and impacts on fund balances, including operating, capital funding needs, and reserve requirements.
  2. Evaluate current rate structure and its ability to generate sufficient revenue under varying consumption patterns, growth assumptions, and cost escalations.
  3. Conduct sensitivity analysis to test the robustness of proposed rates under varying drought, operational, and conservation scenarios (e.g., 10% and 20% demand reduction).
  4. Develop 10-year rate model to set treated water rates for four years and project impact to future treated water rates incorporating planned water supply investments.  
  5. Deliver a fully functional, user-friendly financial planning and rate model in Microsoft Excel format with clearly linked worksheets, visible formulas, and organized tabs. The model must allow Agency staff to adjust key inputs, test assumptions, and view outputs. Provide complete documentation of the rate model, including all applicable spreadsheets and technical assumptions. Train staff on how to operate, maintain, and update the model for future analysis and planning.

 

Deliverables:

  • Virtual meeting with the Finance team to review the model
  • Multiple drafts and final model in MS Excel

 

  1. Cost of Service & Rate Design Study:
  1. Cost-Based Rate Development: Perform a cost-of-service analysis to ensure proposed rates are based on the proportional cost of providing service to each customer class, consistent with Proposition 218 requirements.
  2. Customer Classification Review: Evaluate the Agency’s current customer classifications and analyze historical consumption and demand characteristics to determine whether modifications are warranted.
  3. Untreated Water Rate Structure Review and Assessment: Collaborate with Agency staff to establish rate design objectives and assess the effectiveness of the current rate structure and rate components. Develop and analyze alternative rate structures to address rising water costs from water supply investments, climate change, economic conditions, etc. Evaluate the current annual reconciliation process and recommend alternatives to annual true-ups, etc. Evaluate the feasibility of setting multi-year rates or establishing a reserve fund for the program.  Evaluate customer impacts and provide comparative benchmarking against five peer agencies.
  4. Wholesale Treated Water Rate Review and Assessment: Review and evaluate the Agency’s existing rate structure, including the current fixed and volume-based components to ensure continued revenue stability to meet policy objectives. Evaluate customer impacts and provide comparative benchmarking against five peer agencies.
  5. Policy Review: Review and evaluate the Agency's existing policies to ensure alignment with reserve targets, debt service coverage requirements, financial planning strategies, and industry best practices.

 

Deliverables:

  • Meeting with Finance team to review Cost of Service findings
  • Multiple drafts and one final memo documenting findings

 

  1. Meetings & Communication:
  1. Communicate regularly with Agency staff to provide updates on project progress, coordinate deliverables, and identify potential issues early in the process.
  2. Lead and facilitate all meetings with Agency staff, and, if necessary, with the Board or other identified stakeholders.
  3. Participate in additional meetings as needed to ensure project coordination, share information, address emerging issues, and resolve any unforeseen challenges that may arise during the study process.
  4. Assist with PowerPoint presentations for the Board and other communications materials, to explain rate changes to the public in an easily digestible manner. Materials must be clear, concise, and tailored to the intended audience.

 

  1. Draft Study and Revisions:
  1. Prepare and submit Treated and Untreated preliminary draft memos to Agency staff summarizing the methodology, assumptions, analysis, proposed rate structures, and key findings for internal review, comment, and Board workshop.
  2. Prepare Treated and Untreated Preliminary Draft Water Rate Studies based on feedback from Agency staff and the Board to ensure accuracy, clarity, and alignment with Agency goals and policies.
  3. Prepare and submit Treated and Untreated Final Draft Water Rate Studies for consideration by the Board. After Board approval, prepare Final Treated and Untreated Water Rate Studies incorporating any revisions directed by the Board.
  4. Assist in preparing presentation materials for a minimum of two publicly noticed meetings. Presentations should clearly convey study conclusions, financial impacts, and recommendations.

 

Deliverables:

  • Preliminary memo and draft Water Rate Study
  • Final Treated Water Rate Study
  • Final Untreated Water Rate Study

  1. Additional Services (if budget permits):
  1. The Agency may request supplemental services related to water rate planning, financial modeling, or policy analysis if funding allows.
  2. If additional services are identified after contract award, the Agency will provide a detailed Scope of Work and request a supplemental proposal from the consultant for review and approval prior to initiation of any work.
